about.title: About

general.title: Your keys
general.description: View and copy your public and staking keys
general.removeWalletDescription: Removing it does not affect the wallet balance, and it can be restored at any time.
general.showPubKeyDescription: This lets you import your wallet to other browsers and devices, or to restore it at a later date
general.exportPubKeyDescription: This enable you to easily import your wallet in other browser/devices or to restore it at a later point

removeWalletAlert.title: Hold up!
removeWalletAlert.content: Are you sure you want to remove your wallet? You'll have to restore it with your secret passphrase to access it again.

collateral.title: Collateral
collateral.description: Add and remove collateral in order to interact with smart contracts on Cardano
collateral.amountDescription: Add collateral in order to interact with smart contracts on Cardano. The recommended collateral amount is 5 ₳.
collateral.reclaimBanner: When you remove the collateral amount, it is returned to your account balance and disables your interactions with smart contracts
collateral.notEnoughAda: You don't have enough ADA to proceed with the transaction.

network.title: Network

faqs.drawer.description: Here you can find information about your wallet and blockchain related questions

support.title: Support
support.description: If you're stuck and you can't find the answer to your question in our FAQs, create a ZenDesk ticket and we'll try to solve your issue as fast as we can.

browser.description.2: Please open the extension to continue.

failed.title: Sorry!
failed.subtitle: Data migration failed!
failed.errorDescription: We tried to automatically update your wallet to lace's latest version but something went wrong.
failed.actionDescription: You will need to restore your wallet again with your recovery passphrase

corruptedData.title: Data Corrupted
corruptedData.errorDescription: Looks like some of your data is missing or invalid. Don't worry your funds are safe.
corruptedData.actionDescription: You will need to restore your wallet again with your recovery phrase.

stakePoolSearch.gettingSaturated: This pool starts to be saturated
stakePoolSearch.staking: You are staking on this pool

stakePoolStatusLogo.retiring: This pool is retiring. Re-delegate to an other pool to avoid losing rewards
stakePoolStatusLogo.retired: This pool is retired. Re-delegate to an other pool to receive rewards
stakePoolStatusLogo.delegating: You are delegating to this pool
stakePoolStatusLogo.saturated: This pool is too saturated. Stake on another pool to avoid losing rewards

ticker.title: Ticker
ticker.tooltip: Refers to the unique identifier of a staking pool

cost.title: Cost
cost.tooltip: The cost is not directly paid by the delegator; they are deducted from a pool's rewards, consisting of a fixed cost and a variable cost, which fund the pool's operational costs

apy.title: ROS
apy.tooltip: An estimation of the potential rewards you will earn per epoch if you delegate the intended amount of stake. The system looks at the pool's parameters and historical performance data to calculate potential rewards, assuming that the pool reaches optimal saturation.

saturation.title: Saturation
saturation.tooltip: Once a pool reaches the point of saturation, it will offer diminishing rewards

margin.title: Margin
margin.tooltip: The percentage of rewards taken by the stake pool operator after the fixed cost but before rewards are distributed

blocks.title: Blocks
blocks.tooltip: Total blocks created by the pool.

pledge.title: Pledge
pledge.tooltip: An amount of self‐bonded assets intended to remain staked to the pool for as long as it operates

liveStake.title: Live Stake
liveStake.tooltip: Refers to the total amount of a cryptocurrency that is currently being staked in a particular staking pool

catalystConfirmationStep.confirmBody: Please sign the voting registration transaction. This will link your wallet balance as proof of voting power. Funds will not leave your wallet, but requires a transaction fee, displayed at the bottom of the screen.

catalystPinStep.setPin: Set a PIN code. You'll need it everytime you want to access the Catalyst app and to vote

catalystRegistrationStep.registerNow: In the Catalyst App, click on the 'Register now' button

catalystScanStep.header: Use the Catalyst Voting App to scan the QR code
catalystScanStep.body1: The following QR code is the generated certificate required by the Catalyst App to be able to participate in the voting process of Cardano.
catalystScanStep.body2: We strongly suggest to take a screenshot of the QR code as a backup. You won't be able to access it after clicking on 'Done'.

waitForNextFundCard.title: Waiting for next Fund
waitForNextFundCard.message: While waiting for the next fund you can register your wallet if it is not already done

addressForm.name: Name
addressForm.addNewSubtitle: Save your favorite addresses to find them easily.

authorizeDapp.nonsslTooltip: This site does not follow common web standards

dappTransaction.insufficientFunds: You do not have enough funds to complete the transaction
dappTransaction.tryingToUseAssetNotInWallet: This DApp is trying to use token not held in your wallet.
dappTransaction.noCollateral: Wallet should not be able to sign dapp txs without collateral.

walletSetupLegalStep.title: Lace Terms of Use
walletSetupLegalStep.toolTipText: Please read and accept the terms

walletSetupAnalyticsStep.title: Give us a hand to improve your experience
walletSetupAnalyticsStep.description: By sharing analytics data from your browser, you can help us improve the quality and performance of Lace. For more information on our privacy practices, please see our
walletSetupAnalyticsStep.optionsFooter1: For more information on our privacy practices, please see our

walletSetupConnectHardwareWalletStep.title: Connect hardware wallet
walletSetupConnectHardwareWalletStep.subTitle: Choose the brand of your hardware wallet.
walletSetupConnectHardwareWalletStep.supportedDevicesFull: Lace supports Ledger Nano X, Nano S, Nano S Plus, and Trezor Model T
walletSetupConnectHardwareWalletStep.supportedDevices: Lace is supporting Ledger Nano X, Nano S and Nano S Plus
walletSetupConnectHardwareWalletStep.connectDevice: Just connect your device to your computer, unlock and open the Cardano app to hit continue.
walletSetupConnectHardwareWalletStep.connectDeviceFull: Just connect your device to your computer and unlock it to continue. If you're using a Ledger device, make sure you open the Cardano App.

walletSetupCreateStep.title: Creating your wallet
walletSetupCreateStep.description: Your Lace wallet will be all set up in a few seconds.

walletSetupFinalStep.title: Hurray! All done :)
walletSetupFinalStep.description: It's time to start your Web3 journey. Plus you can follow us to stay up to date on all our latest news and content.

walletSetupMnemonicStep.enterPassphraseDescription: Please enter each word of your recovery phrase in the right order to verify it and recover your wallet.
walletSetupMnemonicStep.body: Now let's check you've got the correct secret passphrase. Enter each word of your passphrase in the right order to verify it.
walletSetupMnemonicStep.passphraseInfo1: Make sure you create an offline backup of your secret passphrase.
walletSetupMnemonicStep.passphraseInfo2: Do not store your backup digitally.
walletSetupMnemonicStep.passphraseError: Make sure the words of your recovery phrase are in the right order and spelled correctly.

walletSetupMnemonicIntroStep.title: Keeping your wallet secure
walletSetupMnemonicIntroStep.description: Consider your recovery phrase as the master key to your wallet, and the only way to access your funds.

walletSetupOptionsStep.title: Hello Web3
walletSetupOptionsStep.subTitle: Choose an option to get started

hardwareWallet.title: Hardware wallet
hardwareWallet.description: Connect your hardware wallet to Lace

restoreWallet.title: Restore wallet
restoreWallet.description: Enter your passphrase to recover your wallet

walletSetupRegisterStep.title: Let's set up your new wallet
walletSetupRegisterStep.description: Choose a name to help you identify your wallet. It will only be visible to you.
walletSetupRegisterStep.passwordDescription: You'll use this to log into your wallet and make transactions.
walletSetupRegisterStep.validationMessage: 8+ characters with at least 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter, 1 number

walletSetupSelectAccountsStep.setupLaceWallet: Let's set up your Lace wallet
walletSetupSelectAccountsStep.chooseWalletName: Choose a name to help identify your wallet and which account you would like to export. You can change this later!
walletSetupSelectAccountsStep.chooseAccountToExport: Choose which account you would like to export.
walletSetupSelectAccountsStep.useHWToConfirm: Use your device to confirm the export of your public key

walletSetupWalletNameStep.chooseName: Choose a name to easily identify your wallet.

walletSetupWalletModeStep.title: Choose your wallet mode
walletSetupWalletModeStep.instructions: You are able to have multiple wallets, each with a different mode selected.
walletSetupWalletModeStep.lightWalletDescription: Light wallet connected to a synced server
walletSetupWalletModeStep.fullNodeWalletDescription: Trustless wallet running on a full node

walletSetupRecoveryPhraseLengthStep.title: Recovery phrase length
walletSetupRecoveryPhraseLengthStep.description: Choose your recovery phrase length of either 12, 15 or 24 words to restore your wallet.

password.feedback.1: Weak password. Add some numbers and characters to make it stronger.
password.feedback.2: Getting there! Add some symbols and numbers to make it stronger.
password.feedback.3: No need for symbols, digits, or uppercase letters.
password.feedback.4: Use a longer keyboard pattern with more turns.
password.feedback.8: Avoid years that are associated with you.
password.feedback.9: Avoid dates and years that are associated with you.
password.feedback.11: All-uppercase is almost as easy to guess as all-lowercase.
password.feedback.12: Reversed words aren't much harder to guess.
password.feedback.13: Predictable substitutions like '@' instead of 'a' don't help very much.
password.feedback.14: Well done! That's one strong password.
password.feedback.15: Hurray! Your password is super strong.

receive.usedAddresses.title: Used Addresses ({{count}})
receive.usedAddresses.subtitle: New addresses are automatically generated after a transaction.

disable.description: Are you sure you want to disable this account? You can re-enable it later

confirmationDialog.title: Are you sure you want to cancel adding a new wallet?

multiWallet.popupHwAccountEnable: Hardware wallets require the <0>expanded view</0> to enable accounts
multiWallet.walletAlreadyExists: Wallet wasn't created because it already exists
